p: However, the simple model herein shows that this logic is incomplete at best. Society would never tolerate a permanent quarantine, as the costs would be too high. The argument for a quarantine, therefore, is not about short-run costs versus long-term benefits per se: it is a pure timing game. And, it is a very specific timing game at that. “The cavalry” (e.g., mass testing, vaccines, therapeutics, etc.) must arrive “just in time”—not too soon or too late—for the benefits of a quarantine to exceed the costs.
